job.title: Chief Technology Officer
job.snippet: Code for America believes government can work for the people, by the people in the 21st century. We build open source technology and organize a network of people dedicated to making government services simple, effective, and easy to use.The Chief Technology Officer (CTO) creates the technical foundation for the change Code for America seeks. We use software applications and user data to help government change how it operates by adopting user-centered, data-driven, and iterative approaches to service delivery.  The CTO leads a team that builds and sustains the core technology that small teams of developers, designers, and product managers use to deliver outcomes with our government partners, and that our network of Brigades use to connect and amplify the impact of the movement.  Code for America’s CTO will:Lead and define technical strategy at Code for America, working as a core business and strategic partner with the Senior Leadership team (Executive Director, COO, and Board of Directors)Define and implement our product strategy to provide consistent value to governments and citizens using open-source softwareLead a team of engineers who understand the needs of our users and our network and support both effectivelyIdentify and/or develop a set of standardized tools and platforms that create efficiency and consistency for the applications our teams useEvolve Code for America’s engineering culture - and work collaboratively to develop a set of approaches and standards that support CfA’s mission and each of CfA’s programs (includes our Focus Areas, Fellowships, Brigades)Coach teams thru a lean/agile process for application developmentDevelop and manage external partnerships and resources and establish guidelines and principles for relationships with vendorsUnderstand existing local government technology and craft a vision that helps our partners transition to 21st century technology infrastructure and approachesWhere appropriate, drive strategic standards initiativesRepresent CfA at conferences, on advisory boards, etcQualifications:Track record of success in consumer and/or enterprise software leadership5-10 years leading teams of diverse creatives, technologists, and/or program managersAbility to collaborate with executives, engineers, designers, salespeople, and clientsTop-notch communications skills. You should be clear, friendly, and persuasive in person and across digital channels.Solid comfort level with open-source technology projects and the tools/languages we useCode for America offers full health and dental benefits, a 401k plan with matching funds and a culture that is collaborative, hardworking and fun.Interested and qualified candidates should submit a resume and cover letter at http://codeforamerica.org/jobs. Candidates will be evaluated on a rolling basis until the position is filled. You may also contact us with any questions at info@codeforamerica.org.About Code for AmericaWe are a six year old startup non-profit with great people and a huge opportunity to make a difference.  We work collaboratively and agilely and strive to learn from everything we do. We respect each other, work hard, and have a great time together.  We’re looking for individuals who share our vision, our values, and our willingness to do what it takes to achieve an ambitious mission over the next few years.Equal Employment OpportunityCode for America values a diverse workplace and strongly encourages women, people of color, LGBT individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply. Code for America is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, disability, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, medical condition or any protected category prohibited by local, state or federal laws.

The Talent Program Manager will be responsible for driving our recruitment efforts; generating interest among technologists to work in or with government; developing the pipeline for Talent through our brigade and fellowship programs; developing content, resources and trainings that provide our talent with the tools and resources that they need to be successful; cultivating our Alumni network as a talent pool for government jobs; and exploring opportunities for partnerships with other organizations in order to accelerate this work.
